docs.snippet: The steamship Edith Godden, whose loss is reported in a cablegram from London, left this port for Montego Bay, Jamaica, with a general cargo, Nov. 15. Capt. Legol and his crew are reported to have been saved and landed at Montego Bay....
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Edith Godden, whose loss is reported in a cablegram from London, left this port for Montego Bay, Jamaica, with a general cargo, Nov. 15. Capt. Legol and his crew are reported to have been saved and landed at Montego Bay.

docs.abstract: Alice A. Parley Lost in the Hudson River
docs.lead_paragraph: DOBBS FERRY, Nov 23.--A barge or canalboat is supposed to have been wrecked off this village early yesterday morning. At that hour there was a good deal of whistling, apparently by tugs out on the river, and yesterday and today considerable wreckage has been picked up along the river front.

headline.main: WAS THERE LOSS OF LIFE?; A CANALBOAT SUNK IN THE HUDSON RIVER.

docs.snippet: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 21.--The seven survivors of the ill-fated steamer Earnmoor of the Earn line, which foundered at sea on Sept. 5 in a cyclone, when 300 miles off Turk's Island, bound from Baltimore to Rio Janeiro, arrived in this city to-day from...
docs.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 21.--The seven survivors of the ill-fated steamer Earnmoor of the Earn line, which foundered at sea on Sept. 5 in a cyclone, when 300 miles off Turk's Island, bound from Baltimore to Rio Janeiro, arrived in this city to-day from New-York, to which port they were brought this morning by the steamer Santiago from Nassau. They tell a story of terrible suffering.

headline.main: THE LOSS OF THE EARNMOOR.; TERRIBLE SUFFERINGS OF THE SEVEN SURVIVORS OF THE WRECK.

docs.snippet: The steamship Santiago, which arrived yesterday from Nassau, brought seven survivors of the wreck of the Earnmoor, the British steamship whose loss has been described in THE TIMES....
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Santiago, which arrived yesterday from Nassau, brought seven survivors of the wreck of the Earnmoor, the British steamship whose loss has been described in THE TIMES.

headline.main: PICKED UP ON THE OCEAN.; ARRIVAL HERE OF THE SURVIVORS OF THE EARNMOOR WRECK.

docs.snippet: The health authorities at Washington received some weeks ago a dispatch from Havana saying that the British bark Jane Law had left Havana with a case of yellow fever on board bound for New-York....
docs.abstract: Jane Law; Overdue with Yellow Fever on Board

headline.main: WHERE IS THE JANE LAW?; A FEVER-PLAGUED BARK MANY DAYS OVERDUE.

docs.snippet: PHILADELPHIA, July 29.--The steamer Thordisa, Capt. Hogarth, which arrived here from Carthagena July 15, was burned to the water's edge shortly before noon to-day in the Schuylkill River at the Point Breeze Oil Works, where she was being loaded wi...
docs.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA, July 29.--The steamer Thordisa, Capt. Hogarth, which arrived here from Carthagena July 15, was burned to the water's edge shortly before noon to-day in the Schuylkill River at the Point Breeze Oil Works, where she was being loaded with oil.

headline.main: A FINE STEAMER BURNED.; THE THORDISA AND A VALUABLE CARGO GREATLY DAMAGED.

docs.snippet: BALTIMORE, May 31.--To-morrow's American will publish a story of one of the most remarkable exhibitions of seamanship on record. It is given in a letter received to-day from Capt. Thomas Robertson of the steamer Hawkhurst by Gustavus  Co....
docs.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE, May 31.--To-morrow's American will publish a story of one of the most remarkable exhibitions of seamanship on record. It is given in a letter received to-day from Capt. Thomas Robertson of the steamer Hawkhurst by Gustavus Co.
